clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Limitations Due To The Foot Involvement In Spondyloarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS DUE TO the FOOT INVOLVEMENT IN SPONDYLOARTHRITIS

lead_sponsor.agency: Vakif Gureba Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Vakif Gureba Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Seronegative spondyloarthritis (SpA) is a group of rheumatic diseases Foot involvement of the SpA is common and enthesitis, erosive changes or ankylosis are the frequent lesions. The functional status of the SpA patients are usually evaluated globally.The aim of this study is to assess specifically the foot -related functional limitations of the SpA patients.

detailed_description.textblock: SpA patients who had foot pain at least for 4 weeks and those having bilateral anteroposterior and lateral feet x-rays will be included into the study. Foot x-rays will be evaluated by a radiologist by using the spondyloarthropathy tarsal radiographic index (SpA-TRI). The foot related functional status of the patients will be determined by the Turkish version of the Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS).

primary_outcome.measure: The foot-related functional status of SpA patients
primary_outcome.description: The foot related functional status of the subjects will be measured with Foot Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS)

study_pop.textblock: patients with SpA and foot pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- SpA patients who had foot pain at least for 4 weeks
- Those having bilateral anteroposterior and lateral feet x-rays will be included into the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had flatfoot
- Previous foot surgery
- Any other disorder unrelated to the SpA will be excluded
